intro: Ecbolium peploides, commonly known as the velvetleaf or woolly broomweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is an annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant has hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, velvety appearance. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in spikes and bloom in the summer months. Ecbolium peploides is often considered a weed but can provide habitat for certain insects and small animals.
